content.description: bouldery start with a couple of tricky spots.  Crux just before the top out.
content.protection: Bolted ring anchor shared with Closed for lunch.
content.location: Route is third route from the left on Dollar Store wall.

climbs.name: Price Check
climbs.fa: Kelley Gilleran, Matt Franklin, and Brad Johnson

content.description: Good warm-up. Crux at the 3rd and 5th bolt.
content.protection:
6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.

Used to share an anchor with Bushmaster, has it's own anchor as of July 13, 2018. Lower off the Busmaster anchor's mussies until the new anchor gets its own.
content.location: 2nd from the left. Starts off a wide head high ledge right of the bush.

content.description:
NOTE: this climb still has a loose block or two down low that I'll remove eventually. I'm marking it pg13 for those loose rocks, a difficult first clip, and the potential sketchiness of climbing through the final roof with ledges below.

Climb up to a tricky first clip (a hidden kneebar helps) then up to a juggy slot and easy climbing via the arete. Traverse across the ledge then climb up through the left side of the roof, where a crux move to a jug awaits. An easier variation that goes right on the roof will eventually get a bolt.

This climb is dirtier than I'd like. I'll clean it up more eventually but all the key holds are more than good enough.
content.location: Goes through the arete and roof just right of the main dollar store wall.

content.protection: 9 bolts long to mussies a few feet right of the ring anchors on Push to Open.

climbs.name: Bushmaster
climbs.fa: Matt Franklin, Kelley Gilleran, and Brad Johnson

content.description:
Good warm-up. Crux at the roof and the anchors.

Edit: Apparently the anchor crux is gone now :(
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with Mussey Hooks. Shares anchor with Price Check.
content.location: Left most route on the wall.

content.description:
Easy stemming, fingers, hands, layback moves through the dihedral leads to a massive ledge with  a tree. Crack goes on 15-20 feet above that on what looks like 5.6 climbing (no bolted anchors). This would be an easy 5.9 trad lead if you're bothering to carry gear. There are plenty of good rests and gear is straightforward.

Alternatively, you can lead Push to Open or Closed for Lunch set up a top rope using the top two bolts on Closed for Lunch as directional pieces. This is a good way to eke out a 5th climb on this wall.

Overall, the climb is still pretty sandy/grainy and could use more traffic. Not nearly as nice as the other climbs on the wall, but its something different.
content.protection: Single rack, fingers-hands. Or top rope.
content.location: Obvious crack in a large dihedral right of Closed for Lunch.
